Role Details: Stephen Miller considers David Horowitz a mentor, and Horowitz was a highly influential figure in Miller's early career. Horowitz's connections were instrumental in helping Miller start his political career. Miller served as the president of the Duke University chapter of Horowitz's 'Students for Academic Freedom' and invited Horowitz to speak at both his high school and Duke University. Horowitz also connected Miller to his first job as a press secretary for Congresswoman Michele Bachmann and later helped him secure a position with Congressman John Shadegg. Horowitz is noted for grooming individuals like Miller through his 'School of Political Warfare,' teaching them to 'use the language of civil rights to attack civil rights.' Miller also collaborated with Horowitz's 'David Horowitz Freedom Center,' an anti-Muslim hate group, organizing events such as 'Islamo-Fascism Awareness Week' and serving as the first national coordinator of the 'Terrorism Awareness Project.' [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

Entity B: DONALD J. TRUMP FOR PRESIDENT, INC.
Role Details: Stephen Miller joined Donald Trump's presidential campaign in January 2016 as a senior policy adviser. He was instrumental in crafting Trump's platform and messaging, particularly influencing its opposition to multiculturalism, globalism, and foreign workers, alongside Steve Bannon. Miller also wrote many of Trump's speeches, including his Republican National Convention speech, and served as a warm-up act for Trump's appearances. He developed the concept of 'nation-state populism' which significantly influenced the 2016 campaign. Miller also assisted with crafting Trump's messaging for his reelection campaign in 2020. [1, 2, 3]
